ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helps students to begin their knowledge of how biology labs are run.

Learned basic laboratory skills and procedures to ensure adequate lab notebook entries were completed, information was fully dictated when results were found, and contamination of samples did not occur.
I learned many common techniques needed in laboratory settings and also the uses of various model organisms.

basic but very broad understanding and sample of biological lab practices. I found this very helpful since I do not get to do a broad range of biological lab protocols and techniques in the lab I work in, so this class was able to introduce me to other branches of biology.
I learned how to properly write a lab report and design a lab experiment. I also learned how to work well with a team in the lab.
the basic procedures in biology lab, and how to write a lab report.
Very useful lab skills of all kinds, while having fun and making it challenging.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The lab procedures weren't always very clear in what we were supposed to do, so part of every class dealt with waiting to be told from Professor Moreno what we were supposed to do, which seemed like a waste of time.
The courses was very interesting and engaging. The lab reports were tough.

High workload, long hours (hard to stay focused), and was a writing credit although 0.5 WR credit is not useful for anyone to complete the WR credit requirements. Professor was very engaging and helpful.
The course has a lot of writing elements that should count toward a full writing credit instead of just a half writing credit.

strength: the experiments were pretty cool and engaging. weaknesses: directions and expectations were sometimes unclear. wouldve loved to have a syllabus at the beginning of the class to know what to expect for the whole semester.
Very well structured, a lot of feedback, and interesting experiments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If the student is or is thinking that he/she may be interested in research, this is a great course to test the waters.
It is high workload so not unless they need the class.
If this student needs a half credit writing course or wants a basic understanding of the biology lab, I would recommend this course.
yes, if you need to take an intro bio lab this one was a decent one. Professor Moreno is a very understanding person and very knowledgeable about biology!
Yes. Very useful skills that every scientist should know! Totally recommend
